section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock: DROP OPERATOR CLASS [IF EXISTS] name USING index_method [CASCADE | RESTRICT]

section.title: Description
section.p: DROP OPERATOR drops an existing operator class. To execute this command you must be the owner of the operator class.

plentry.pd: Do not throw an error if the operator class does not exist. A notice is issued in this case.
The name (optionally schema-qualified) of an existing operator class.
The name of the index access method the operator class is for.
Automatically drop objects that depend on the operator class.
Refuse to drop the operator class if any objects depend on it. This is the default.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Remove the B-tree operator class widget_ops:
section.codeblock: DROP OPERATOR CLASS widget_ops USING btree;
section.p: This command will not succeed if there are any existing indexes that use the operator class. Add CASCADE to drop such indexes along with the operator class.

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: There is no DROP OPERATOR CLASS statement in the SQL standard.
